name: atomic-structure
title: Atomic Structure
description: Some very basic notes on Atomic Structure and Periodicity.
author: Alex Moss

name: bioinorganic-chemistry
title: Bioinorganic Chemistry
description: Mostly adapted from Prof Armstrong's Lecture Notes, with a few Tutorial Essays thrown in.
author: Alex Moss

name: coordination-chemistry
title: Coordination Chemistry
description: Info about HSAB Principle, Coordination Geometries, Isomerism and Complex Stability
author: Alex Moss

name: descriptive-p-block-chemistry
title: Descriptive p-Block Chemistry
description: Covers some of the descriptive chemistry of the p-Block, done by Group (12 to 18)
author: Alex Moss

name: descriptive-transition-metals
title: Descriptive Transition Metals
description: Covers some of the descriptive chemistry of each element in the Transition Metals section of the Periodic Table.
author: Alex Moss

name: electronic-spectroscopy
title: Electronic Spectroscopy
description: Notes on most aspects of Electronic Spectroscopy, which covers some Advanced Inorganic Level topics.
author: Alex Moss

name: inorganic-nmr
title: Inorganic NMR
description: Notes on the basics of NMR in Inorganic Chemistry, I think mostly taken from the Primer. See Physical Notes for more about the theory.
author: Alex Moss

name: inorganic-reaction-mechanisms
title: Inorganic Reaction Mechanisms
description: Details on the basic types of mechanism and redox pathways, with information on how this can be detected using kinetic studies. Mostly taken from a variety of lecture notes.
author: Alex Moss

name: lanthanides-and-actinides
title: Lanthanides and Actinides
description: Mostly Descriptive Chemistry, but discusses why the chemistry occurs as well. There is some more detail on Uranium at the end. Adapted from Dr Heyes' Lecture Notes
author: Alex Moss

name: magnetism
title: Magnetism
description: Brief Notes on Magnetism, I think from Dr Cox's lectures.
author: Alex Moss

name: mo-theory-and-bonding
title: MO Theory and Bonding
description: Notes on MO Diagrams and LCAO for simple molecular compounds and complexes. This is pretty much entirely a cut-down version of Dr Mountford's lecture handouts.
author: Alex Moss

name: non-metal-chemistry
title: Non Metal Chemistry
description: General discussion of the trends amongst the Non-Metals and reasons behind them, plus some comparisons between elements towards the end. Adapted from a variety of sources.
author: Alex Moss

name: organometallics
title: Organometallics
description: General Notes on this topic, covering the 18e rule, alkyls, carbonyls and sandwich complexes, and then a large section of Reaction Mechanisms common to Organometallic Reactions at the end. Adapted from the two Primers, plus Dr Mountford's and Prof O'Hare's lectures.
author: Alex Moss

name: inorganic-physical-methods
title: Inorganic Physical Methods
description: General discussion of this, with a glossary, but not much specifics on the techniques (except EPR and Matrix Isolation)
author: Alex Moss

name: review-of-the-periodic-table
title: Review of the Periodic Table
description: Basically the lecture course delivered by a number of lecturers towards the end of third year. Good general revision material.
author: Alex Moss

name: post-transition-metals
title: Post-Transition Metals
description: Some general characteristics and chemistry, followed by descriptive notes.
author: Alex Moss

name: pre-transition-metals
title: Pre-Transition Metals
description: Covers the ionic model and lattice enthalpies (plus the Kapustinskii Equation), with some structures and thermodynamics towards the end.
author: Alex Moss

name: advanced-solid-state
title: Advanced Solid State
description: Only covers the topics I chose to study for - namely Synthesis, Intercalation, Ruddlesden-Popper Phases, Superconductors and Zeolites
author: Alex Moss

name: solid-state-electronics
title: Solid State Electronics
description: General level Solid State covering electronic properties, i.e. Band Theory, Types of Metals, Mott-Hubbard Insulators, Trends in Metals, Superconductors and special examples, then Defects and Ionic Conductivity. Little bit on Experimental Methods at the end.
author: Alex Moss

name: solid-state-structures
title: Solid State Structures
description: Mostly first year material on structural types and predicting them, but some essays from 3rd year about Transition Metal cases are included.
author: Alex Moss

name: solutions-and-redox
title: Solutions and Redox
description: Some basic notes on Acids and Bases and Redox Reactions (Frost Diagrams, Pourbaix Diagrams, etc).
author: Alex Moss

name: transition-metals
title: Transition Metals
description: Thorough notes on most aspects of Transition Metal Chemistry. Largely adapted from Prof Denning's lecture notes, with some extra bits thrown in.
author: Alex Moss

name: vibrational-spectroscopy-and-group-theory
title: Vibrational Spectroscopy and Group Theory
description: Mostly an advanced topic, although there's some Symmetry and Group Theory notes in here which are useful for General.
author: Alex Moss

name: x-ray-diffraction
title: X-Ray Diffraction
description: X-Ray Diffraction Notes that cover both general and advanced level. Also includes notes on Neutron Diffraction, EXAFS, etc.
author: Alex Moss

name: alicyclic-chemistry
title: Alicyclic Chemistry
description: Basic notes on conformation and reactivity.
author: Alex Moss

name: aromatic-and-heterocyclic-chemistry
title: Aromatic and Heterocyclic Chemistry
description: Covers aromatic reaction types, then moves onto the Synthesis and Reaction Types of each class of Heterocyclic Compound. Mostly from the two primers on these topics.
author: Alex Moss

name: chromium-iron-and-cobalt-in-synthesis
title: Chromium Iron and Cobalt in Synthesis
description: Advanced Level Only. I didn't end up doing this topic, so they're actually just the lecture notes reproduced without editting, but may be useful to some!
author: Alex Moss

name: general-organic-mechanisms
title: General Organic Mechanisms
description: Very introductory - has acids and bases, nucleophilic substitution, elimination and addition reactions. Also the ester hydrolysis mechanisms and a few named reactions at the end. Generally brief.
author: Alex Moss

name: reactive-intermediates
title: Reactive Intermediates
description: Carbenes, Nitrenes and Arynes covered, particularly generation and reactions. Fairly basic level though.
author: Alex Moss

name: organic-spectroscopy
title: Organic Spectroscopy
description: Basics of interpreting UV, IR, Mass Spec and NMR for Organic compounds. Also has a useful shapes and shifts diagram at the end.
author: Alex Moss

name: organoelements
title: Organoelements
description: Covers Organonitrogen, Organoboron, organosilicon, organophosphorus and organosulphur reactions and reagents. Mostly from the primers (where appropriate) but added to from core texts too.
author: Alex Moss

name: organometallics
title: Organometallics
description: Divided into saturated, unsaturated and aromatic metallated compounds. Fairly simple, but useful for going over pre-Finals.
author: Alex Moss

name: peptides
title: Peptides
description: Advanced Level Only - not too many mechanisms either as they're easy but I've covered most of the protection and conversion options and structure determination. Lots from the Primer, but filled in the bits it missed.
author: Alex Moss

name: pericyclics
title: Pericyclics
description: Very thorough notes on the different types of Pericyclic Reactions. Probably covers advanced as a large part of them is made up of lecture notes. I didn't use them much though - too complicated!
author: Alex Moss

name: physical-organic
title: Physical Organic
description: A series of mini-essays on the concepts behind Physical Organic Chemistry. Rarely comes up, except of course the year I sat Finals ...
author: Alex Moss

name: protecting-groups-and-carbohydrates
title: Protecting Groups and Carbohydrates
description: Covers Protecting Groups (On and Off methods, although omitted mechanisms as they're very easy, and then moves onto some useful sugar transformations (although this doesn't often come up on Finals any more)
author: Alex Moss

name: rearrangements
title: Rearrangements
description: Some basic notes at the start, then covers examples and mechanisms later on.
author: Alex Moss

name: free-radicals
title: Free Radicals
description: Covers generation through reaction types and mechanism onto synthetic uses. I did this topic at Advanced level so should be fairly comprehensive. Mixture of Primer and Lecture Notes.
author: Alex Moss

name: oxidation-and-reduction-in-organic-synthesis
title: Oxidation and Reduction in Organic Synthesis
description: Divided into Oxidation then Reduction. Covers the lecture notes, with more basic useful conversions thrown in (which are actually more helpful!)
author: Alex Moss

name: stereochemistry-and-stereoelectronics
title: Stereochemistry and Stereoelectronics
description: Some very basic conventions and symmetry rules, before moving onto Stereoelectronics Notes (most of which come from the Primer)
author: Alex Moss

name: stereoselective-synthesis
title: Stereoselective Synthesis
description: Quite a bit of Advanced level content, although covers the basics early on.
author: Alex Moss

name: applications-of-statistical-mechanics
title: Applications of Statistical Mechanics
description: Starts with basic revision of Statistical Mechanics, then moves on to 2-Level Systems, Equilibrium Constants, etc (the more common exam questions!)
author: Alex Moss

name: atomic-spectroscopy
title: Atomic Spectroscopy
description: Notes mostly from the Primer, starting with Hydrogen then moving to Alkali Metals and Helium.
author: Alex Moss

name: electrochemistry
title: Electrochemistry
description: Notes from the Primer, with examples.
author: Alex Moss

name: electronic-spectroscopy
title: Electronic Spectroscopy
description: Short notes specific to Electronic Spectroscopy, e.g. Selection Rules. Recommend the other Molecular Spectroscopy Notes first.
author: Alex Moss

name: kinetics-and-mechanism
title: Kinetics and Mechanism
description: Basic Ideas, Activation Energies, Steady State Approximation, then more complex reactions such as Enzyme Kinetics
author: Alex Moss

name: modern-liquid-kinetics
title: Modern Liquid Kinetics
description: Some great notes on this topic taken from some lecture notes from a few years before me.
author: Alex Moss

name: molecular-interactions
title: Molecular Interactions
description: Covers microscopic and macroscopic interactions. Moves on to Mixtures and De-Bye Huckel Theory and so on. There are some gaps in this early on.
author: Alex Moss

name: molecular-spectroscopy-and-energy-levels
title: Molecular Spectroscopy and Energy Levels
description: Contains basic facts to know, and an introduction to approximations and selection rules for molecular energy levels.
author: Alex Moss

name: photochemistry
title: Photochemistry
description: Based on lecture notes in Photochemistry. Bit short.
author: Alex Moss

name: physical-nmr
title: Physical NMR
description: Theory behind NMR, and nature of Chemical Shifts and Spin Coupling. Moves on to Chemical Exchange and Relaxation Mechanisms.
author: Alex Moss

name: quantum-mechanics
title: Quantum Mechanics
description: Covers basics and postulates, before moving onto applications, e.g. particle in a box, on a ring, etc etc.
author: Alex Moss

name: reaction-dynamics
title: Reaction Dynamics
description: Concentrates on bimolecular reactions and Transition State Theory, and includes things like the Kinetic Isotope Effect and Temperature-dependence.
author: Alex Moss

name: rotational-spectroscopy
title: Rotational Spectroscopy
description: Discussion of basic formulae, selection rules and so on relevant to rotational spectroscopy.
author: Alex Moss

name: rovibrational-spectroscopy
title: Rovibrational Spectroscopy
description: Incorporates Vibrational Energy Levels into molecular spectroscopy, so covering IR and Raman.
author: Alex Moss

name: statistical-mechanics
title: Statistical Mechanics
description: Covers origins of molecular partition function, then addresses translational, rotational, vibrational and electronic components.
author: Alex Moss

name: surfaces
title: Surfaces
description: Fairly brief notes on isotherms and rates of reactions at surfaces. Also some experimental methods at the end. Not my favourite topic!
author: Alex Moss

name: thermodynamics
title: Thermodynamics
description: Starts with simplistic uses of the laws of thermodynamics before moving onto Phase Equilibria, Phase Diagrams and Mixtures.
author: Alex Moss

name: valence
title: Valence
description: Starts with the background to the approximations involved in this, then works through the Variation Principle and how it applies to a range of simple molecules. Finishes with Huckel Theory.
author: Alex Moss
